message.content:
cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.SE, cs.AR 

Reasoning: 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): Fog computing is a distributed computing paradigm that aims to bring cloud computing closer to the edge of the network, and this paper specifically focuses on the technologies for fog computing nodes as building blocks of fog computing. 
- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): Fog computing heavily relies on networking and communication technologies, and this paper discusses the interconnection of edge devices through wireless communication technologies. 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): Fog computing involves the design and implementation of systems that can efficiently process and analyze data at the edge of the network, and this paper discusses the core functionalities of a fog node. 
- cs.SE (Software Engineering): Fog computing requires the development of software systems that can run on edge devices and interact with cloud infrastructure, and this paper discusses the lessons learned from the implementation of fog computing technologies. 
- cs.AR (Hardware Architecture): Fog computing involves the deployment of hardware devices at the edge of the network, and this paper discusses the role of edge devices in the definition of a fog node.
